formattedAddress: 211 W 20th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 211 W 20th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Visited during a trip and had a great experience! Employee at bag check was great and helped ease my concerns about leaving my bag up front, and everyone working there had a great attitude. Lots of products in different price ranges (I even spotted some Lip Service and Tripp NYC) and the ‚Äúpay pig‚Äù tip jar was a cute bonus! Would definitely shop here againüíï

originalText.text:
I will start off by saying that except for the very inappropriate comments made by one of the employees, the rest of the staff was kind and helpful. I don‚Äôt want to be unfair with my rating since it was just one awful employee and the store itself was great with lots of options, hence why I‚Äôm not leaving a one star review even though it‚Äôs tempting considering how awful I feel currently due to the comment from said employee. I just want to highlight and hopefully the employee can learn how harmful their words are and maybe not jump on people for no reason.

I had picked up a blouse to show my friends when out of nowhere an older employee came up behind me and proceeded to go on about how I had picked up the wrong size (mind you how could he know if it was my size or if it was even for me considering all I did was pick the shirt up and show it to my friend). The employee then proceeded to talk to me like I was stupid and was unnecessarily mean, going on about ‚ÄúDid you even check the size at all? That‚Äôs not your size, that‚Äôs a 2xl and the size for you is all the way down there.‚Äù All I did was pick up a shirt to show my friend and then a second later I‚Äôm being yelled at for not picking my own size? I hadn‚Äôt check the size as I was just looking at the shirt itself since it had caught my eye, I hadn‚Äôt asked to try it on or anything. Simply looking and showing a friend. I understand the concern of someone buying something that‚Äôs not their size and taking away from someone else who needs it but I just picked it up to show my friends. I have been plus size for the majority of my life so I understand how hard it is to find cool clothes like this in a wide size range but as someone who has recently lost said weight due to an illness it really wasn‚Äôt great having my size highlighted to the whole store and being made out to be stupid and a bad person for simply picking up a shirt and being reminded of something out of my control. It really turned me away from purchasing anything or stopping back in. The people I was with couldn‚Äôt believe how unnecessarily rude the interaction was considering the rest of the staff was so kind. It‚Äôs like the employee wanted to go out of his way to be rude. Maybe think next time how to better frame your words without being so unkind as you never know what someone is going through.

originalText.text:
Purple Passion was recommended to me by a friend who is both a kink/BDSM performer and a frequent customer. Unfortunately, I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in my experience here.

I was looking around for leatherwear in NYC ‚Äî being a transgender man, I hate the experience of online shopping and much prefer buying gear in person. Spent quite a bit of time on the store‚Äôs website looking at their offerings, but at the time of my visit I was being paid only in cash and opted to stop by instead of going through the hassle of depositing $$.

I stopped by the next day after my shift and immediately upon stepping in the door and greeting the woman working the counter‚Äî an old white woman‚Äî she gave me an extreme glare, no greeting and sneered ‚Äúyou need to leave.‚Äù

I was taken aback and asked her to repeat herself: she then instead asked my age. I‚Äôm twenty. She asked if I had ID. I don‚Äôt carry my wallet with me to work (long story), so I told her I didn‚Äôt, but that (my friend‚Äôs name) had told me to check out the store. She then told me very harshly and flippantly that she didn‚Äôt care who sent me, get out and that no one underage is allowed in the store, there‚Äôs a 21+ policy. VERY rude and hostile the entire time, treated me like less than nothing.

I had no idea there was any kind of 21+ policy at Purple Passion previous to this. I haven‚Äôt experienced something like this anywhere else in NYC. I operate under the assumption that all sex stores have an 18+ policy unless stated otherwise. It‚Äôs nowhere on this listing. There‚Äôs also absolutely nothing on the website.

I‚Äôm aware that as a transgender man I can appear much younger than I am. If she had gently explained that there‚Äôs some kind of 18+ policy I would have just returned the next day with ID. If I‚Äôd been politely informed of a harsh in store 21+ policy I would‚Äôve just left and gone about my day. Instead I was treated as if I was some 14-year old troublemaker coming to laugh instead of a customer ready to drop a substantial amount of money on leatherwear, blatantly making it obvious that she did not believe me to be of age. I‚Äôm not typically picky about customer service but this was really an appalling experience. I understand checking the ID of anyone who appears underage, but the level of disrespect was unwarranted.

If there had been some kind of Terms and Conditions on the website that clearly stated a 21+ policy, I wouldn‚Äôt have come all the way across Manhattan and wasted my time being disrespected. I‚Äôm of legal age. I‚Äôve bought kink gear for years. I would gladly take my business elsewhere. If I‚Äôm able to purchase sex toys on your website with absolutely NO problems, why am I unable to visit your storefront without being RUDELY and IMMEDIATELY turned away?

I‚Äòve asked around and the experience of being so harshly and quickly kicked out to the curb‚Äî  as if I had absolutely no potential as a customer‚Äî is not shared by young male cisgender friends of mine who regularly shop here, reporting no problems, never being interrogated or kicked out.

Your business has the right to refuse whomever you please, and to take whatever measures you like to ensure that no minors buy from your store. But if you‚Äôre going to do so, add your age restraint to your website or this listing so you don‚Äôt waste anyone else‚Äôs time. And perhaps let your employees know they need to work on their bedside manner.

originalText.text: This is the best shop in the city. Go! If you open your eyes, you will find something you like. They have everything, from shoes, latex, leather, PVC, chains, Bondage, lace, collars, a huge array of ‚Äòhitty‚Äô impact toys, vibrators, plugs, restraints, rope, collars, cuffs, etc‚Ä¶ . They are super helpful. They are real. Don‚Äôt be shy. There is no shame here. Just ask! No one will bite‚Ä¶ if you are afraid of that, they can show you the gags. :) Shop Purple Passaion so we can still have places that let us try things and help us learn. Have fun!

originalText.text:
It is an absolutely wonderful shop with friendly and very helpful staff. 10 stars out of 5 possible for good service and a large assortment of good quality items.They also have a basement full of awesome shoes to die for.
Highly recommended!
